title: Kiran — GCSE & A-Level Achievement
pullquote: I was aiming for a 6 or 7. Getting a 9 was a huge surprise and a great achievement.
summary: Kiran joined GG Maths in Year 10, predicted a Grade 6 in GCSE Maths. With tailored lessons and step-by-step guidance, he turned weaknesses into strengths, achieving a top 2% Grade 9 at GCSE. Carrying this mindset into A-Level, we fast-tracked Year 12 content, giving him extra time for Year 13’s toughest topics. The result: an A in A-Level Maths and a place at University of Birmingham to study Mathematics and Music.

title: Adrian — From Struggling in Year 7 to Confident in Year 9
pullquote: In less than six months, he started picking it up and he started performing at above 80%.
summary: When Adrian joined GG Maths in Year 7, his maths results were below 50%. With one-to-one tutoring, clear step-by-step lessons, and targeted homework, he rebuilt his skills and confidence. In just six months, his marks rose to 85%. Now, learning topics ahead of class gives him a clear edge — proof that the right support can turn setbacks into success.

title: Emily — From B to A* at A-Level
pullquote: The step from GCSE to A-Level was huge, but I felt supported every step of the way.
summary: Emily was aiming for a B in A-Level Maths but wanted an A* to secure a place at her dream university. We focused on advanced problem-solving, calculus, and proof techniques, building depth of understanding. She achieved her A* and gained a place at Cambridge.

title: Matthew — Confidence and Results
pullquote: I used to think I wasn’t a ‘maths person’ — now I know I can do it.
summary: Matthew entered Year 10 struggling with maths and self-belief, predicted a Grade 4. By starting with strong foundations and building up to more complex topics, his confidence soared. He achieved a Grade 8 in GCSE Maths and now feels ready for any challenge.
